articles.headline: China’s Electric Cars Keep Improving, a Worry for Rivals Elsewhere
articles.snippet: More capable autonomous driving is just one way Chinese automakers are threatening to pull ahead — their E.V.s are also becoming bigger and roomier.
articles.abstract: More capable autonomous driving is just one way Chinese automakers are threatening to pull ahead — their E.V.s are also becoming bigger and roomier.
articles.lead_paragraph: Automakers in China are building a new generation of bigger, more technologically advanced and competitive electric cars, threatening to leap further ahead of their global rivals as they step up exports around the world.

articles.headline: Federal Money Is All Over Milwaukee. Biden Hopes Voters Will Notice.
articles.snippet: White House officials have barnstormed Wisconsin to make the connection between big changes and their signature laws.
articles.abstract: White House officials have barnstormed Wisconsin to make the connection between big changes and their signature laws.
articles.lead_paragraph: Across Milwaukee, residents can see evidence of federal money from laws passed under the Biden administration, if they know where to look.

articles.headline: Fed Holds Rates Steady, Noting Lack of Progress on Inflation
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve left interest rates unchanged for a sixth straight meeting and suggested that rates would stay high for longer.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve left interest rates unchanged for a sixth straight meeting and suggested that rates would stay high for longer.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials left interest rates unchanged and signaled that they were wary about how stubborn inflation was proving, paving the way for a longer period of high borrowing costs.

articles.headline: Hey, A.I. Let’s Talk
articles.snippet: Meta, Google and others are driving a renaissance for voice assistants, but people have found the technology uncool for more than a decade.
articles.abstract: Meta, Google and others are driving a renaissance for voice assistants, but people have found the technology uncool for more than a decade.
articles.lead_paragraph: A pair of glasses from Meta shoots a picture when you say, “Hey, Meta, take a photo.” A miniature computer that clips to your shirt, the Ai Pin, translates foreign languages into your native tongue. An artificially intelligent screen features a virtual assistant that you talk to through a microphone.

articles.headline: Arizona Lawmakers Repeal 1864 Abortion Ban, Creating Rift on the Right
articles.snippet: Two Republican state senators broke with their party to ensure final passage of the repeal. Gov. Katie Hobbs, a Democrat, is expected to sign it on Thursday.
articles.abstract: Two Republican state senators broke with their party to ensure final passage of the repeal. Gov. Katie Hobbs, a Democrat, is expected to sign it on Thursday.
articles.lead_paragraph: Arizona lawmakers voted on Wednesday to repeal an abortion ban that first became law when Abraham Lincoln was president and a half-century before women won the right to vote.
articles.byline: By Jack Healy and Elizabeth Dias
